intro: Koeleria pontarlieri, commonly known as the Pontarlier's grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. The plant features slender, upright stems with narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. Its small, pale blue or purple flowers are clustered in spikelets, typical of the grass family. Koeleria pontarlieri is adapted to cold, arid environments and is often found in alpine or rocky habitats.
